授業目的: This course is designed for students who need an introductory historical background of modern Korean society. Rather than tracing its history chronologically, we will examine the volatile geopolitical situation of contemporary Korean society and look back at the events that led to the current situation. We will also examine the legacy of Japan’s colonial rule, the historical influence of the United States, and contemporary issues such as militarism, gender, social movements and education.
到達目標:
Through this course students will be able to learn a part of modern Korean history and society.

Students will be able to:
1. have an introductory historical background to modern Korean society by examining the volatile geopolitical circumstances of contemporary Korea, and looking back at the events that led to the current situation.
2. know the legacy of Japan’s colonial rule, and the historical influence of the United States on modern Korean society.
3. understand issues such as militarism, gender politics, social movements, and education of modern Korean society
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
